definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The interviewer is just trying to get a leg up on you in negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 面試官在談判中只是氣勢洶洶。

sentences.english: When the boss found me goofing off, he came down on me like a ton of bricks.
sentences.chinese: 當老闆發現我偷懶時，氣勢洶洶地訓斥了我一頓。

sentences.english: We shall never be cowed by the bluster of reactionaries .
sentences.chinese: 我們決不會被反動派的氣勢洶洶所嚇倒。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
